dengue.title: Dengue: Community guidance
dos: Drink plenty of fluids (ORS, water, coconut water).
Use mosquito repellent and sleep under a net.
Get tested early (NS1/platelets) if fever is high or persistent.
donts: Avoid aspirin/ibuprofen without medical advice (bleeding risk).
Do not ignore warning signs like bleeding gums or severe abdominal pain.
seek_help: Severe abdominal pain, persistent vomiting, bleeding, extreme weakness, or breathlessness.

malaria.title: Malaria: Community guidance
dos: Get a blood test if fever comes with chills/sweating cycles.
Use mosquito control (nets, repellents, remove stagnant water).
Rest and stay hydrated.
donts: Do not delay testing if fever continues beyond 24–48 hours.
seek_help: Confusion, severe weakness, yellowing of eyes, breathing trouble, or high fever not reducing.

chikungunya.title: Chikungunya: Community guidance
dos: Rest joints and stay hydrated.
Use mosquito prevention to avoid spread.
Consult a doctor if joint pain is severe or prolonged.
donts: Avoid heavy exercise during acute joint pain.
seek_help: Severe joint swelling, high persistent fever, or symptoms lasting beyond 1–2 weeks.

typhoid.title: Typhoid: Community guidance
dos: Drink boiled/filtered water and eat hygienic food.
Seek medical testing if fever lasts >3 days with weakness.
Maintain hydration.
donts: Avoid street food and untreated water during outbreaks.
seek_help: High fever for several days, severe weakness, abdominal pain, or confusion.

covid.title: COVID-19 / Viral respiratory illness: Community guidance
dos: Wear a mask in crowded spaces if cases are rising.
Isolate if you have fever/cough and avoid exposing others.
Seek testing if symptoms are significant or exposure is likely.
donts: Don’t ignore breathlessness or low oxygen symptoms.
seek_help: Breathing difficulty, chest pain, blue lips, or oxygen concerns.

tuberculosis.title: Tuberculosis (TB): Community guidance
dos: Get checked if cough lasts >2 weeks, especially with fever/weight loss.
Visit a TB clinic for sputum/CBNAAT testing.
Cover mouth when coughing and avoid close contact until evaluated.
donts: Don’t self-medicate for weeks without testing.
seek_help: Coughing blood, severe breathlessness, weight loss, or fever lasting weeks.

gastroenteritis.title: Gastroenteritis / Stomach infection: Community guidance
dos: Use ORS and fluids to prevent dehydration.
Eat light foods (banana, rice, toast) if tolerated.
Use clean drinking water.
donts: Avoid oily/spicy food while symptoms persist.
seek_help: Blood in stools, severe dehydration, high fever, or vomiting that prevents drinking fluids.

h1n1_swine_flu.title: H1N1 / Swine flu-like illness: Community guidance
dos: Mask up if clusters appear in school/office.
Rest, hydrate, and monitor fever.
Consult a doctor if symptoms worsen or you are high-risk.
donts: Don’t go to crowded places while symptomatic.
seek_help: Breathing difficulty, persistent high fever, or worsening cough.

jaundice.title: Jaundice (possible hepatitis): Community guidance
dos: Get liver function tests and consult a clinician.
Drink safe water and maintain hygiene.
Eat light and avoid alcohol.
donts: Avoid alcohol and very oily food.
seek_help: Severe abdominal pain, confusion, very dark urine, or persistent vomiting.

seasonal_flu.title: Seasonal flu / Viral fever: Community guidance
dos: Rest, hydrate, and use basic fever care.
Mask if you are coughing to protect others.
Monitor symptoms over 48 hours.
seek_help: Breathing trouble, chest pain, persistent high fever, or severe weakness.
